rules: Rule1: Provided that PPE equipment is available during a pandemic period, an outbreak is controlled.

Rule2: Either PPE equipment is sufficient, or if it is not the case that medical supplies being available during a pandemic period leads to an outbreak being controlled, then medical supplies are not sufficient.
Rule3: Whenever a remote village is located in a forest area, PPE equipment is not sufficient.
Rule4: Under the condition that an isolated community is located in a mountain region, PPE equipment is not sufficient.
Rule5: If a remote village is affected by a disease, then it must be located in a forest area or an isolated community is situated in a mountain region.
Rule6: Either a remote village is affected by a disease or an isolated community is affected by a disease.
Rule7: Provided that an isolated community is affected by a disease, a remote village is located in a forest area or an isolated community is located in a mountain region.

Rule8: Provided that an emergency unit coordinates containment, and if a laboratory technician works in lab analysis, then whenever the outbreak not being controlled does not imply that an epidemic causes an outbreak, a vaccine contains a treatment.
Rule9: Quarantine measures are delayed or medical response is not delayed.

Rule10: If contact tracing is successful, then if it is not the case that a laboratory technician working in lab analysis leads to the condition that the outbreak not being controlled implies an epidemic causes an outbreak, which in turn implies a vaccine contains a treatment, then lab testing fails.
Rule11: Provided that social distancing is implemented, a mask mandate is implemented.
Rule12: If a mask mandate is implemented, then contact tracing is successful.
Rule13: If a training program is inadequate, then resource allocation is inadequate.
Rule14: Provided that resource allocation is inadequate, a surveillance system is inadequate.
Rule15: If treatment is delayed, then intervention is delayed.
Rule16: If an epidemiologist works in a field study, then the outbreak not being controlled leads to an epidemic causing an outbreak, which implies a vaccine contains a treatment.
Rule17: An epidemiologist works in a field study or a laboratory technician works in lab analysis.

Rule18: If an early warning system detects an outbreak, and if it is not the case that disease surveillance monitoring an outbreak leads to the condition that a laboratory technician working in lab analysis implies that the outbreak not being controlled leads to an epidemic causing an outbreak, which in turn implies a vaccine contains a treatment, then treatment is delayed.

Rule19: Provided that community reporting detects an outbreak, and if it is not the case that disease surveillance monitoring an outbreak implies that a laboratory technician working in lab analysis leads to the condition that the outbreak not being controlled implies an epidemic causes an outbreak, which implies a vaccine contains a treatment, then treatment is delayed.
Rule20: If genomic sequencing analyzes a virus, then an early warning system detects an outbreak.
Rule21: Genomic sequencing analyzes a virus or a pathogen study analyzes a virus.
Rule22: If a pathogen study analyzes a virus, then a new variant is identified.
Rule23: Whenever a virus mutation is identified, community reporting detects an outbreak.
Rule24: Provided that a new variant is identified, lab results are confirmed.
Rule25: If lab results are confirmed, then field tests are confirmed.
Rule26: Provided that field tests are confirmed, a virus mutation is identified.
Rule27: Whenever a case study reports a remote village, the remote village is located in a forest area.
Rule28: A case study reports a remote village or an epidemiological report reports an isolated community.
Rule29: Under the condition that a health ministry reports an isolated community, the isolated community is located in a mountain region.
Rule30: Whenever disease mapping is accurate, data collection is not incomplete.
Rule31: Provided that a transmission model is accurate, data collection is not incomplete.
Rule32: A serological survey is conducted or an antibody study is conducted.
Rule33: Under the condition that an antibody study is conducted, a transmission model is accurate.
Rule34: A public health expert evaluates a strategy or an international team evaluates a strategy.
Rule35: Provided that an international team evaluates a strategy, and if a serological survey is conducted, then disease mapping is accurate.

Rule36: A containment plan is rejected or a prevention protocol is rejected or if a public health expert evaluates a strategy, then provided that a serological survey is conducted, disease mapping is accurate.
Rule37: Under the condition that a researcher investigates transmission patterns, disease surveillance monitors an outbreak.
Rule38: A researcher investigates transmission patterns or a public health worker investigates transmission patterns.

Rule39: Provided that a public health worker investigates transmission patterns, and if a laboratory technician works in lab analysis, then the outbreak not being controlled leads to an epidemic causing an outbreak, which implies a vaccine contains a treatment.
Rule40: Whenever disease surveillance monitors an outbreak, a response team coordinates containment.
Rule41: Provided that disease surveillance monitors an outbreak, a health organization monitors an outbreak.

Rule42: Under the condition that a health organization monitors an outbreak, and if a laboratory technician works in lab analysis, then the outbreak not being controlled leads to an epidemic causing an outbreak, which implies a vaccine contains a treatment.
Rule43: Medical supplies are available during a pandemic period or PPE equipment is available during a pandemic period.
Rule44: If it is not the case that a response team coordinating containment leads to an emergency unit coordinating containment, then medical response is delayed.
Rule45: Provided that it is not the case that an epidemiological report reporting an isolated community implies a health ministry reporting an isolated community, data collection is incomplete.

Rule46: Under the condition that it is not the case that a laboratory technician working in lab analysis implies that the outbreak not being controlled leads to an epidemic causing an outbreak, which implies a vaccine contains a treatment, then lab testing does not fail.

Rule47: Provided that it is not the case that disease surveillance monitoring an outbreak leads to the condition that a laboratory technician working in lab analysis implies that the outbreak not being controlled leads to an epidemic causing an outbreak, which in turn implies a vaccine contains a treatment, a training program is inadequate.
Rule48: Whenever it is not the case that medical supplies being available during a pandemic period leads to an outbreak being controlled, medical supplies are sufficient.
Rule49: Under the condition that it is not the case that the outbreak not being controlled implies an epidemic causes an outbreak, a vaccine does not contain a treatment.
Rule50: Provided that an outbreak is not controlled, an epidemic does not cause an outbreak.
facts: Fact2: Quarantine measures are not delayed.
Fact3: A surveillance system is not inadequate.
Fact5: A prevention protocol is not rejected.
Fact6: A containment plan is not rejected.
